result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan C. Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs are to be paid while on probation on Cts 2 & 3.

Huber allowed.
Deft to complete the living Free Program ASAP.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consective to Ct 1 and Concurrent to 15CF570.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Pay DNA surcharges.
May not have contact with felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

records.addlTxt: Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney W Michel II. Clerk/H. Barnett. On ct 2 the court imposes a total sentence of 24 months WSP consecutive to 15CF570:  18 months initial confinement; 6 months extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; on ct 3 the court imposes a total sentence of 24 months WSP concurrent to ct 2 and consecutive to 15CF570:  18 months initial confinement w/credit for 218 days served; 6 months extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP.
Copy of e-mail from DOC Agt Sue Cole with amended revocation order and warrant, correcting second lnie of probation which said 3/14/17, corrected to 3/14/16.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 20, 2017 at 10:30 am.
P&P Agent requests revocation date; revocation packet forthcoming
120 days KCJ as a condition of probation
E-mail from DOC Agt Susan Cole.

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan C. Schneider
Current: 4777 88th Ave, KCDC, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2015)
Prior: 5412 40th Avenue  #2, Kenosha, WI 53144
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statements from:  Carla O., Cathy O.  On ct 1 the court imposes sentence of 1 year jail w/Huber privileges, credit for 137 days served, deft to complete the Living Free Program ASAP; costs ordered, to be paid during period of probation on cts 2 & 3; on cts 2 & 3 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 18 months w/conditions, consecutive to ct 1 and concurrent to each other and to 15CF570; deft to pay $600 DNA surcharge.

With Atty Edwards and ADA McNeill the SEH of 10/26/15 at 3:30pm is rescheduled, as Atty Edwards will be in trial and has just received the PSI and has not had a change to review it w/deft yet; reset to 10/29/15 at 11am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 1 & 2 and guilty to ct 3.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1, 2 & 3.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 10/26/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 9/10/15 at 1:15pm and JS 10/26/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Hilary Edwards. Clerk LE. Case trails 15CF570. DAPT on 7-17-15 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 7-31-15 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.

123 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clk  LE.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Referred to intake court for further dispo on 6/26/15 @ 845 a.m.  Atty  Edwards Moves to dismissed Ct 1 - Court denies motion.   $1500 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription. *No drug paraphernalia   *No Contact w/Holly S or Karissa B or their residences
946.41(1) - Obstructing repeater  /  961.573(1) - Poss of drug paraphernalia repeater  /  946.49(1)(a) - Misd BJ repeater
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA C McNeill.
